definition: lit. ashes burn once more (idiom); fig. sb lost returns to have influence/sth malevolent returns to haunt one
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)

sentences.english: Glue- sniffing among Singapore's youth is making a worrying comeback after many years in decline.
sentences.chinese: 沉寂多年的青少年嗅吸強力膠現象死灰復燃。

sentences.english: What does this resurgence of tribalism mean to the foreign policy community?
sentences.chinese: 這種部落主義的死灰復燃對外交政策界意味着什麼？

sentences.english: All of this has led to a resurgence of religiosity.
sentences.chinese: 所有這一切都導致了宗教信仰的死灰復燃。

sentences.english: Because period of treatment is too short, bring about pathogenic bacteria resurgence and cause recrudesce.
sentences.chinese: 由於療程過短，導致致病菌死灰復燃而引起復發。

sentences.english: Superstitious activities have come to life again recently.
sentences.chinese: 近來，封建迷信活動又死灰復燃了。

sentences.english: old allegations of forced overtime burbled back to life.
sentences.chinese: 強迫加班的古老惡俗又死灰復燃。

definition: frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
criminal ringleader, main offender (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster
